The Real Leadership Lessons of Steve Jobs

Sixth months after Job's Death, The author of his best selling biography identiples the practices that every CEO can try to emulate. by walter Isacson

His saga is the entrepreneurial creation myth. Steven Paul Jobs (born Abdul Lateef Jandali, February 24, 1955 â€“ October 5, 2011) was an American business magnate, inventor, and investor. He was the co-founder, chairman, and CEO of Apple; the chairman and majority shareholder of Pixar; a member of The Walt Disney Company's board of directors following its acquisition of Pixar; and the founder, chairman, and CEO of NeXT. He was a pioneer of the personal computer revolution of the 1970s and 1980s, along with his early business partner and fellow Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak.
